favourite.article: I just finished singing this hymn to dedicate me afresh to my Maker once again on this morning of my birthday.

The third verse of this great hymn kept ringing in my mind and I had to look it up here. Before the hills in order stood, or earth received her frame, from everlasting Thou art God, through endless years the same. So let our King be lifted high, now and forevermore; amen.
Thank you and I so appreciate this old hymn. The God of this hymn remains faithful, the same yesterday, today and for ever. Heb 13:8. Amen
I just heard church bells playing this hymn and couldn't remember all the words, so I looked it up here. Beautiful.
Love this song.

Takes me back about 26 years ago, my first year in secondary school to be precise. I'm assured today that Jesus is the same yesterday, today and forever more. So happy hearing and singing this hymn once again.
The hymn is one of my best—it keeps reminding me of the fact that without Him (God), I can do nothing. That God the Holy Spirit is all the Help I need in all matters in life.

Since my High school years, this song has ministered to me and continuing. The stanzas speak of hope in the only entity that matters most above all things - God. Those that found refuge in Him have never been taken by surprise of what life might bring to them.
Indeed He is God that help from ages past until now and forever He will continue to help us. HALLELUJAH!
This is my family song.

The Lord has been my help, without Him am nothing. This hymn reminds me of that and gives me strenght to conquer. Lord You are my help in ages past present and tomorrow. Guide me while this life last.
This is an awesome hymn.
O God our help in ages past is really a masterpiece. We sometimes forget that if not for God who has been our helper, our situation would have been worst.

I love this hymn. It is a reminiscence of the activities of past happenings, and also the expectations of the future..... It has the effect of giving the courage ton face tomorrow with determine nation that all will be well. God will bless the writer in Jesus' Name.
This song is wonderful and always encouraging to me. I always sing the song during peace and war times of my life. God is my only help.

As I leave my lecturer' office today who told me I am at the verge of failing his course. This song kept on ringing in my mind and as I remember the past help and goodness of the Lord in my life my soul is being lifted and my heart merry. Because God of yesterday is still God of today. Children of God as you read this comment kindly pray for me to receive favour from my lecturer as touching my examination such that I should not fail in them.

This Hymn is my best hymn, it was sang on my wedding day and I always sing it on the last day of every year, to show how grateful I am for the whole, and trusting God for the new year, Oh God Our help in ages past and also Our hope for years to come, been our guard while life shall last. God bless the writer of the hymn.

This song is a paraphrase of Psalm 90 by Moses. It seems Moses wrote it when he was ready to depart this world. Orthodox Jewish publications also use Watt's hymn [i.e. "Pentateuch & Haftorahs" pub. by Socino Press]. --------- Except for 12 psalms which he felt were unsuited for Christian usage, Watts paraphrased in song the entire book of Psalms in "The Psalms of David Imitated in the Language of the New Testament" published in 1719. This hymn was sung at Winston Churchill's funeral. It is the University Anthem of the University of California, Berkeley and of many other colleges. Stanza 5 above is quoted in many secular books. - Wikipedia --------------- The 1st and last stanzas, 1st line, originally says "Our God". John Wesley changed it to "O God" in his hymnal "Psalms and Hymns" in 1738. Both versions are in current usage. - Wikipedia ------------ Last stanza, 3rd line originally says: Be Thou our guard while troubles last, (The alternate "while life shall last" was in the Lutheran hymnal in 1814. -hymnary.org) ------------------- There are additional stanzas that are usually omitted: 3b Thy Word commands our flesh to dust, “Return, ye sons of men:” All nations rose from earth at first, And turn to earth again. --------- 4b The busy tribes of flesh and blood, With all their lives and cares, Are carried downwards by the flood, And lost in following years -------------- 5b Like flowery fields the nations stand Pleased with the morning light; The flowers beneath the mower’s hand Lie withering ere ‘tis night.
This is indeed a great hymn for ages past, present and in future.
This Hymn sure brings peace and comfort to our souls. Glory to the Lord!

Franklin D. Roosevelt choose this hymn to be sung at the church service the morning of his first inauguration as the 32nd President of the United States. He knew he would need God's help as he undertook the enormous task of leading this country. In fact, he would eventually face the most terrible of wars during his time as President. This great hymn expresses so much about our dear Savior and Lord. Indeed, "Under the shadow of Thy throne Thy saint have dwelt secure!"

This is the summary of who God is to me. Beyond the colours of religion and denominations, God is our eternal strength and anchor. I live within the boundaries of this hymn, the past, the present and the sure future.

Issac Watts sure had a depth of understanding of the highly invaluable nature of that thing called Time! Someone has said life is not lost by dying. Life is lost minute by minute, day by dragging day, in all the thousand uncaring way. May the good Lord give us all an understanding of the invaluable potentials of that singular gift He has given to to all earth comers in equal amount irrespective of their family, pedigree or the color of their skin.

This song refreshes my spirit at the end of every year and gives me new hope for the year ahead. We need Our God every second, minute, hour, day, week, month year, decades, generation and century. Be with us O Lord we pray.

Remembering my Father Chief Joseph Oduola Ogunniran, my brother John Olaleka Ogunniran and my uncle Dr Christopher Olaseinde Adeoye, the three people that shaped my life, may their souls rest in peace, they all loved this song.
Our God in ages past is my favourite song.
“LORD, YOU have been my dwelling place throughout all generations and will always be. Without YOU, I am helpless."

i appreciate my late father Chief C.O Ihensekhien (SAN) who personally taught me this special hymn, it has helped me over the years and its been a solid foundation for my immediate family....may you continue to rest in the bosom of our Lord Jesus Christ.

God is all we have. God is all we need. I recently lost my mom to cancer. We were best friends for four decades and spoke for hours every day. We have both walked with the Lord our entire lives and have minds and hearts full of the Word. The last month of her life, I spent 18 hours a day at her bedside, but barely said a word to her. She had many, many Christian visitors, but very few people said anything. She died surrounded by Godly people who loved her, but in human terms, she died alone. In the end, God is all we have. We must use every day - every moment of our loneliness to cultivate feeling and desiring and loving His presence because God is all we have. God is all we need. To Him be glory.

When I heard about the tragedy that happened in Connecticut, O Lord Our Help in Ages Past was the only song that I kept singing. I thank the writer of this song, it gives strength and console me in times of grieving.
Under Thine throne saints have dwelt secure......Lord! Dear Lord Thou has been our hiding place in all generations....Thank You LORD!!
Remembering the good old days in Community Secondary School, Obazu, Mbieri and Holy Trinity Anglican Church, Obazu. God is always faithful.
It gives me hope and assurance that there is a future for me in Christ.
This hymn has become my greatest prayer. It summerises my past, present and future in Christ. An inspirational hymn that leads us to eternity
This hymn speaks truth across all religions, faiths, beliefs.
These hymn serve as stronge defence to us, the believers. May the strongest one, The Almighty God uphold the producer of these site to a successful end.

God, Abraham, Isaac and Israel will forever remain our God! the pillar of this earth right with Him in His hands, this song of Isaac humbles me each time I listen to it and the words...in all may the earth keep praising You forever our God!
O God our help in ages past. Thank you my Redeemer and my High Priest for the assurance that You will always be there.
O God our help in ages past, our hope for years to come. What a wonderful reassurance to know that God is there for us when all hope is lost!!

O God my help in ages past, my hope for years to come! Always relevant, this hymn always come handy as my prayer of hope and trust. His testimony of faithfulness is so sure.
Thank You Lord God, thank You so much Lord Jesus Christ. Hebrews 13:8.
Thank you Lord for giving meaning to my days!
God, You are my only hope, both now and forever more. What can I do without You? Absolutely nothing. I love You Lord.
O God our help in ages past, our hope for years to come. What a wonderful and comforting thought to know God is always with us and is our help for years to come. Praise God!
